Package utility

Class PositionCalculator

java.lang.Object
utility.PositionCalculator
public class PositionCalculator extends Object
This is a helper class for converting mouse positions on the GUI to grid position / coordinates in the model, and for checking where the mouse is on an individual tile / gate on the board.

The mouse position is given w.r.t. the upper left corner of the grid.

Version:
2, July 2022
Author:
Dominik Baumann

  • Method Details

    • mousePositionToGridCoordinates

      public Vector2Int mousePositionToGridCoordinates(Vector2Int pos)
      Convert the position of the mouse on the GUI to grid coordinates.
      Parameters:
      pos - Position of a mouse click.
      Returns:
      The coordinates of the tile / gate the mouse was over.

    • validStartPositionOnTile

      public BoolGateIndexTuple validStartPositionOnTile(TileType t, Vector2Int pos, Vector2Int coord)
      Check if a given position is over the output or an input of a gate.
      Parameters:
      t - Type of tile / gate
      pos - Position (of a mouse click) relative to the board's upper left corner.
      coord - Coordinate of the tile on the Board in (row, column)-format
      Returns:
      True iff the click was on an input or the output of the tile.

    • overOutput

      public BoolGateIndexTuple overOutput(Vector2Int pos, Vector2Int coord)
      Check if the mouse is over an output.
      Parameters:
      pos - Position of the mouse click.
      coord - Grid position of a gate / tile.
      Returns:
      True iff the mouse was over the input of the gate.

    • overSoloInput

      public BoolGateIndexTuple overSoloInput(Vector2Int pos, Vector2Int coord)
      Check if the mouse is over the input of a gate / tile with only one input.
      Parameters:
      pos - Position of the mouse click.
      coord - Grid position of a gate / tile.
      Returns:
      True and GateIndex TOP iff the mouse was over the output of the gate.

    • overDoubleInput

      public BoolGateIndexTuple overDoubleInput(Vector2Int pos, Vector2Int coord)
      Check if the mouse is over one of the inputs of a gate / tile with two inputs.
      Parameters:
      pos - Position of the mouse click.
      coord - Grid position of a gate / tile.
      Returns:
      True and the corresponding GateIndex iff the mouse was over an input of the gate.

    • validEndPositionOnTile

      public BoolGateIndexTuple validEndPositionOnTile(TileType t, Vector2Int v, Vector2Int pos)
      Check if the position of the mouse is a valid end position for a connection. Note that this is a purely cosmetic function, as any start position is also a valid end position. Whether these positions actually form a proper connection is handled elsewhere.
      Parameters:
      t - The type of tile / gate.
      v - The position of the mouse.
      pos - Coordinate of the tile / gate on the board as (row, column).
      Returns:
      True iff the click was on an input or the output of the tile.

    • getGateIndexFromPositionOnTile

      public GateIndex getGateIndexFromPositionOnTile(TileType t, Vector2Int v)
      Find out which input / output the mouse is at.
      Parameters:
      t - The type of tile / gate.
      v - THe position of the mouse.
      Returns:
      null if the mouse was over the output, or the corresponding GateIndex if the mouse was over an input.

    • getLinePoint

      public Vector2Int getLinePoint(TileType t, Vector2Int coord, GateIndex index)
      Compute the position at the center of an input / output on a tile.
      Parameters:
      t - The type of tile / gate.
      coord - The grid coordinates of the tile / gate.
      index - Specifies the TOP, BOTTOM input or the output.
      Returns:
      The position at the center of the indicated input / output.

    • validateMousePosition

      public boolean validateMousePosition(Vector2Int v)
      Check if the mouse position actually is on the grid.
      Parameters:
      v - Position of the mouse.
      Returns:
      True iff the mouse is over the grid visualizing the model.
